refsection.title: DESCRIPTION
refsection.para: The function SSL_CONF_CTX_set1_prefix() sets the command prefix of cctx to prefix. If prefix is NULL it is restored to the default value.

refsection.title: NOTES
refsection.para: Command prefixes alter the commands recognised by subsequent SSL_CTX_cmd() calls. For example for files, if the prefix "SSL" is set then command names such as "SSLProtocol", "SSLOptions" etc. are recognised instead of "Protocol" and "Options". Similarly for command lines if the prefix is "--ssl-" then "--ssl-no_tls1_2" is recognised instead of "-no_tls1_2".

If the SSL_CONF_FLAG_CMDLINE flag is set then prefix checks are case sensitive and "-" is the default. In the unlikely even an application explicitly wants to set no prefix it must be explicitly set to "".
If the SSL_CONF_FLAG_FILE flag is set then prefix checks are case insensitive and no prefix is the default.

refsection.title: RETURN VALUES
refsection.para: SSL_CONF_CTX_set1_prefix() returns 1 for success and 0 for failure.

refsection.title: HISTORY
refsection.para: These functions were first added to OpenSSL 1.0.2
